header:
What's the use of being an editor of Perl Weekly,
if I can't occasionally abuse that privilege to promote my local Perl Mongers group?
Five of us are giving short tech talks next Monday (27th), if you fancy joining us.
subject: Tech talks in Reading, UK next Monday

entries.author: miguel_prz
entries.text: Miguel Prz (NICEPERL)'s regular lists: Great modules released last week; MetaCPAN weekly report; StackOverflow Perl report.
entries.title: NICEPERL's lists

entries.author: yuki_kimoto
entries.title: DBIx::Custom 0.38 release
entries.text: Kimoto-san has released a new version of DBIx::Custom, dropping some features that have been deprecated for the last 5 years.

entries.author: sawyer_x
entries.text: Sawyer's weekly update from the P5P mailing list.
entries.title: P5P Mailing List Summary: March 6th-12th

entries.text: The cpan.org and perldoc.perl.org sites are now available using https, and are CDNified thanks to Fastly. Thanks to Fastly.
entries.title: Fast and secure Perl docs and CPAN modules with help from Fastly
entries.author: robert_spier

entries.title: Wrapping a C shared library with Perl and XS
entries.text: Stealing the first line of Steve's post: this tutorial shows how to wrap a C shared library using XS and Perl (including creating a trivial test shared library).
entries.author: steve_bertrand
liztormato
entries.title: Tidy Da Tags
entries.text: The weekly round-up of Perl 6 news, the headline for which was DrForr's first release of Perl6::Tidy.

entries.title: Considering hyper/race semantics
entries.text: Jonathan introduces hyper and race, two Perl 6 methods which will be getting nailed down in the next release of the Perl 6 language definition, 6.d (the language is defined by the testsuite).
entries.author: jonathan_worthington
moritz_lenz
entries.title: Plotting using Matplotlib and Inline::Python
entries.text: Moritz plots some data in Perl 6, in another extract from his Perl 5 book.
Dave does some Pi-related hacking in Perl, in honour of Pi day.
entries.title: Coding for Pi Day
entries.author: dave_jacoby
gabor_szabo
entries.text: Gabor introduces the Cwd module, and shows the differences between the cwd() and getcwd() functions.
entries.title: Current working directory in Perl (cwd, pwd)

entries.author: neil_bowers
entries.title: TVPM Tech Talks in Reading, UK
entries.text: We're having a session of short tech talks at Thames Valley Perl Mongers, next Monday (27th March), if you fancy joining us? Topics are PDF::API2, synchronising databases, custom reports for Netdisco, packaging for Debian, and the River of CPAN.

entries.author: dave_cross
entries.text: Dave wants to know what training course he should run at YAPC::Europe this year. If you care, let him know please.
entries.title: What Training Should I Run In Amsterdam?

entries.author: makoto_nozaki
entries.title: Dave Mitchell's February 2017 report
entries.text: The monthly update on Perl 5 work done by Dave Mitchell, supported by a Perl 5 development grant.

entries.title: Komodo 10.2.1 Released
entries.text: ActiveState have released a new version of the Komodo IDE. No new features, but a bunch of fixes.
entries.author: nathan_rijksen
pat_kua
entries.text: Giving and receiving feedback can help both individuals and projects. But done wrong it can just plain suck, and when you're doing open source for fun, it can really suck. Pat shares some tips from colleagues, on giving and receiving feedback.
entries.title: The Gift of Feedback (in a Booklet)

entries.author: phil_keslin
entries.title: Launching Pokémon Go
entries.text: Phil Keslin, CTO of Niantic, explains how the engineering team prepared for--and just barely survived--the experience of launching Pokémon Go.

entries.title: Docker Image Vulnerability Research
entries.text: Apparently, 24% of latest Docker images have significant vulnerabilities.
entries.author: james_sulinski
